reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A big hit
reviews.reviewText: My 11 year old grandson loves this book and can't wait to read the next 2! He is hoping for many more after that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great art and an engaging story.
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful book. It was a little much for my 3-year old granddaughter, but I loved it, and I think it will be just right for her in another year or too. The protagonist struggles with self-doubt in a way that I have never seen before in this format, providing an emotional depth that increased my sympathy for her instead of annoying me. I look forward to reading it again when my granddaughter is a little older.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Your kid is going to love this series
reviews.reviewText: My kid LOVES these books. She can't wait for bedtime when I read it to her. The illustrations are great and captivating. The story is imaginative. Can't recommend this enough!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 4 year old loves these books and so do I
reviews.reviewText: This is a lovely youth appropriate graphic novel that both my 4 year old and I both enjoyed. It's one of the only books my kid has asked to read repeatedly. I would absolutely give this as a gift to older kids as well. I was a huge fan of ElfQuest as a young adult and was searching for a graphic novel that my 4 year old may enjoy, but without the nudity or as much violence. Lightfall was exactly what I was looking for to excite the very big imagination of my young, story loving kid. There are some "scary" parts (a shadowy bird figure named Kest), which depending on your little readers may scare them too much, but kids around 7 and up, I doubt it would be too scary. My 4 year old is kind of hard to scare. We also bought the 2nd book. It was wonderful as well. We look forward to all sequels!If you're looking for ideas for graphic novels for your little reader: I also tried graphic novels such as the Giants Beware series, Wings of Fire, CatStronauts and more. Lightfall beat all others we tried for my kid so far. Giants Beware series came in close though. He lost interest in Wings of Fire I think because there was too much going on, but maybe great when he's older. Had we found Hilda before Netflix made it into a show, I think he would have loved Hilda as a graphic novel maybe as much as Lightfall too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4 bright and shining stars for the Keepers of the Endless Flame!
reviews.reviewText: 4 bright and shining stars for the Keepers of the Endless Flame!Such a fun, whimsical, inventive, artistic, and adventurous middlegrade graphic novel! I really appreciated the character development, the way Probert drew anxiety and how that was represented throughout the work, and how Bea gains strength and confidence in her friendship with Cad. Love these 2 unlikely heroes and gobbled up this first installment in this series in 1 single sitting. And, I think you will too!

reviews.reviewText: My grandkids love adventure stories and comic books. This is all in one for them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My 11 year old daughter loves this book and the next, she reads them over and over and is anxiously anticipating the 3rd book.

We LOVE this book. We just got it for my sons 8th birthday and almost read through the entire book in one sitting. Illustrations are beautiful. Easy to read. And a lovely story. We will absolutely be getting book 2!
IT'S A GREAT STORY, LOVELY VISUALS, EXCITING UNIVERSE! CAN'T WAIT FOR MORE! (AND TO SEE AN ANIMATED FEATURE OF IT) =)
Bin ziemlich kritisch bei Comics, doch der hat es echt in sich !
A mi hija de 9 años le ha encantado y ya está por el segundo. El inglés es relativamente fácil y no es demasiado infantil, por lo que les gusta más. Muy divertido y buenos personajes y dibujos.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: Ok so it is a YA comic for wee girls but it is great and I love it.
reviews.reviewText: I am not sure how to start this review? A vague 'do not give too many secrets away' sort of synopsis I suppose. The story in brief concerns a young girl who lives with her adopted grandfather who is a somewhat forgetful wizard and ... a pig. Whilst she is on an errand in the magical ancient forest in which she and her grandfather make thier home she gets into a bit of a sticky situation and learns that sarcasm is probably not a good way of asking for help. Fortunately she is rescued by the larger than life Cadwallader a Galdurian looking for her grandfathers help in finding all the other Galdurians. Unfortunately when they get home her grandfather has left! And so 'high ho Bilbo AWAAAAY!' they are off on a quest to find the magic pig. The whole book is charming, it is deeply pervaded with a sense of wonder and a complex back story. Unfortunately the story is just the first episode of several, so get your finger out Mr Probert. A wonderful story for young women with a sense of adventure and elderly gentlemen with similar.
